titleStmt.title: The last vvill and testament of Sir James Independent. Who lyeth now dangerously sick of a disease, called by some, the resolution of the Parliament and citie, to oppose their mutinous army; by others, the impossibilitie of Independencie. With his confession, admonition, and legacies left to his deare children, in and about the Citie of London. With his death, buriall, and epitaph.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
